  focusing on index.html and its related files. i want you to look at how the website works, displays, functions
  and continue its forward development. a new area that i also want you to pay attention to is that many

  appropriate, one example is the main navigation bar on top of the canvases. another important example of shared
  code is the png and viobox pixel perfect identical matching. It shares the same code so it cannot misalign or
  mismatch. here are specific files written abou this:
  "\\wsl$\Ubuntu\home\avid_arrajeedavey\vioverse-refactor\css\shared-components.css"
  "\\wsl$\Ubuntu\home\avid_arrajeedavey\vioverse-refactor\css\shared-examples.css"
  "\\wsl$\Ubuntu\home\avid_arrajeedavey\vioverse-refactor\js\shared-navigation.js"

Do not make any changes on this . this is for you to completely understand the current state. Follow my instruction for changes.














Let's add the features and styling and functionality of the vioTaggers tools area of the sidebar.

We use the same size headings which you can see in the image "\\wsl$\Ubuntu\home\avid_arrajeedavey\vioverse-refactor\viotagger-sidebar.png" 

the heading "1.select bureau and creditor to begin" style is the same as the heading used for the report sidebar heading "filter this report". It uses the same CSS, sizes, position, etc. Below the heading are two side-by-side boxes (on one row) that have similar but different functionality. These boxes have the same styling to the severity summary boxes in terms of side-by-side boxes. In the first box on the left "bureau-selector", size is flexible but my example os 1210 px; y177 px; w109 px; h90 px (use these numbers as a guide, not absolute), these are flexible for responsive); fill based on CSS from FCRA review summary elements and visual inspection of the viotagger-sidebar.png". bureau-selector three radio style buttons stacked on top of each other and the buttons are styled in the same way that the "filter this report" buttons are styled. It's a white circle with a blue outline if it is unselected, and a red circle with a blue outline if it is selected. Only one button can be selected and the choices are Equifax, then Experian, then TransUnion. 


In the box to the right of the bureau-selector is the creditor-selector, it will be sized appropriately to fit all the buttons and the names of the buttons would be all 13 creditors all spaced out evenly, buttons the same size, and then they have all the different abbreviations for each creditor. For instance, AL is ALLY, and then BB is Best Buy, and BK is Bank of America, etc. See \\wsl$\Ubuntu\home\avid_arrajeedavey\vioverse-refactor\viotagger-sidebar.png for all names.

here is more specific info:
üß† Claude Prompt: Custom Radio-Like Selector Groups (Visual & Behavioral Spec)
You are implementing two custom-styled radio button groups using outlined circle selectors inside rounded rectangle containers. These are not real HTML radio inputs ‚Äî they are div-based elements that behave like radio buttons.

üîò GROUP 1: Bureau Selector (Vertical Stack ‚Äì 3 items)
Labels (in order):

Equifax

Experian

TransUnion

Behavior:

Only one option can be selected at a time.

When clicked, the selected item shows a filled red circle (#ff0000); others show an empty circle.

Circle Button Styling (all 3 options):

Size: 13px x 13px

Stroke: 2pt solid #253541

Fill (selected): #ff0000

Fill (unselected): #ffffff (white)

Circle remains centered beside text

Container Styling:

Rounded box: 32px corner radius

Fill: #e3e2e1 (which is a 30% tint of #b7b5b3)

Stroke: 1pt solid white

Box-shadow: small, soft (outer glow style, subtle elevation)

üîò GROUP 2: Creditor Selector (Grid Layout ‚Äì 13 items)
Labels (in order):
AL, BB, BK, BY, C1, C2, CR, DB, DL, HD, JP, MF, SR

Behavior:

Only one item can be selected at a time.

Selected item shows a filled red circle.

Others remain outlined (unfilled).

Styling:

Same as Group 1:

Circle size: 13px x 13px

Stroke: 2pt #253541

Fill: #ff0000 when selected, #ffffff when not

Grid layout (approximately 4 items per row, auto-wrap)

Container Styling (Same as above):

Rounded rectangle: 32px corner radius

Fill: #e3e2e1

Stroke: 1pt solid white

Box-shadow: small and soft

‚úÖ Additional Notes
Groups are independent ‚Äî selecting one in Group 1 does not affect Group 2.

Text should be vertically centered next to the circle.

Use flexbox or grid layout for clean alignment.

On click, the selected state should update visually and logically (update selected index/class).

Let's see if you could style that first section. And the way it works is a credit bureau is selected, only one, and then the user selects a creditor. In my example, I have Equifax for the bureau and the second box is creditors. I selected AL, which is ally. When that happens, when you select both, the next stack appears as number two, "select a report page and date", and two side-by-side boxes (or one box appears below that heading, depending on if it's a one- or two-pager report) and you make a selection there, and you can see what they're named, e.g."\\wsl$\Ubuntu\home\avid_arrajeedavey\vioverse-refactor\assets\reports\AL-EQ-2024-04-25-P58.png"
"\\wsl$\Ubuntu\home\avid_arrajeedavey\vioverse-refactor\assets\reports\AL-EQ-2024-04-25-P57.png"
. And once you make a selection, immediately in the viotagger canvas displays with the selected png
and the 3rd stack appears : here is some info about it:
3. click & multi-drag vioboxes on page
IMPORTANT! Once you select both a bureau (e.g., Equifax) and a creditor (e.g., AL for Ally), the next stack automatically appears:
‚Äú2. select a report page and date.‚Äù

You‚Äôll see one or two side-by-side boxes below that heading depending on how many pages exist for that report.
Each box is styled just like the Bureau and Creditor selectors (white background, red fill on selection, black label text).
Each label reflects the exact PNG filename, such as:
AL-EQ-2024-04-25-P58.png
(Example path: \\wsl$\Ubuntu\home\avid_arrajeedavey\vioverse-refactor\assets\reports\AL-EQ-2024-04-25-P58.png)

After you select a report page, the canvas will load the PNG, and the Viotagger becomes active.

IMPORTANT! select all violations you see for this page, then drag them onto the canvas in one motion.
Boxes will auto-snap ‚Äî just fine-tune their vertical position as needed.

(This paragraph should be set in 11pt Space Grotesk, with the word "IMPORTANT!" in bold red, and the rest in mixed bold/regular per the existing style.)


üì¶ Step 3: Viobox Display Logic & Styling After Report Page Selection
Once a user selects both a bureau and creditor, and then selects a report page, the system will:

üß† Auto-Load Vioboxes (Based on Selected PNG Page)
Vioboxes are pulled dynamically from a connected data source:

CSV, Airtable, or API

Each viobox corresponds to specific violations found on the selected PNG.

Only the violations relevant to the selected credit report page will appear in the list.

For example, selecting:
LI-EQ-2024-04-25-P58.png
would trigger loading of violation data tied specifically to that page.

These boxes serve as user prompts ‚Äî they show exactly what the user should look for on the visible credit report canvas.

üé® Viobox Styling (Standard)
Each violation box uses the following style defaults:

Container Position (reference layout only):

x: 1210px, y: 488px, w: 390px, h: 32px (based on 1920√ó1080 design)

Must be fully responsive, not fixed

Border Radius: 32px

Fill Color: #e3e2e1 (30% tint of #b7b5b3)

Stroke:

Default: 1pt white

Selected State: 1pt #f26419

Box Shadow: Small, soft outer shadow to give mild elevation

Label Text: Dark gray/black, using Space Grotesk, with optional bolding for violation subtypes (e.g., INCLUDED_IN_CHAPTER_13)

üñ± Selection Behavior
The user can multi-select any number of visible boxes (Shift+Click).

Once selected, the boxes are dragged as a group onto the canvas.

They will auto-snap horizontally to pre-defined SNAP POS (e.g., EQ-A, EQ-B)

The user can then fine-tune vertical position and resize as needed.









üß© VioTagger Canvas: Viobox Types, Behavior, and Interaction Rules
Once a report page is selected, the Viotagger canvas appears and enables detailed annotation. The tagging system operates as follows:

üìå Viobox Types (One per Bureau)
Each credit bureau has its own type of viobox:

EQ-viobox ‚Äî for Equifax

EX-viobox ‚Äî for Experian

TU-viobox ‚Äî for TransUnion

These are color-coded and behaviorally distinct per bureau.

üìç SNAP POS (Horizontal Snap Positions)
Each bureau has predefined X-axis snap positions to align vioboxes consistently on the canvas. For example:

EQ-A, EQ-B, etc.

Similar patterns will exist for EX and TU as needed.

üìù Standardized Descriptions (Per Bureau)
Since 99% of FCRA violations are consistent within each bureau, each bureau uses a centralized list of description types.

EQ-DESC ‚Äî e.g., Included_In_Chapter_13, Charge-Off_Post_Discharge, etc.

EX-DESC ‚Äî same types, matched to Experian

TU-DESC ‚Äî same types, matched to TransUnion

(You can list out the exact XX types under each later.)

üéØ Tagging Actions and Controls
üîπ Multi-select + Drop:

User can select multiple vioboxes (using Shift+Click) and drag them to the canvas as a group.

Upon release, the vioboxes snap to their default SNAP POS.

Once placed, each viobox can be:

Moved: Drag or use arrow keys ‚Üí live x, y captured.

Resized: Drag corner/side handles ‚Üí live width, height captured.

üîπ Single-select + Drop:

Works exactly the same as above but for a single viobox at a time.

üîπ Copy & Paste:

Ctrl+C to copy one or more selected vioboxes

Ctrl+V to paste onto the canvas (coordinates captured)

üìê Sizing Defaults
Width: Bureau-specific default per viobox type (editable)

Height: Same default height across all vioboxes and all bureaus

üß† Data Persistence
As users place and adjust vioboxes, all interaction data is stored in memory:

x, y, width, height, type, description, bureau, snap_pos

Data is preserved until exported to CSV or synced to Airtable.

1.content:
‚úÖ CLAUDE PROMPT ‚Äî FIX VIOTAGGER LAYOUT MISMATCH
You must fix a critical issue in the Viotagger layout system: the report image shown in the viewer must match the original credit report exactly in scale, proportions, and positioning. Currently, the image is compressed and misaligned, which breaks the pixel-accurate positioning of violation boxes. This is unacceptable.

Here are the detailed instructions:

üß± CONTAINER STRUCTURE RULES
.report-canvas-container should act as the outer wrapper, with fixed dimensions to contain the scaled image.

.report-canvas must not constrain size. It must match the natural image resolution (typically 1920√ó1080 px).

.report-image (the PNG) must:

Render at its native resolution (1920√ó1080)

Never be scaled, squished, or resized via CSS

Must not be limited by its container‚Äôs max-width or max-height

üõë DO NOT:
Do not apply overflow: hidden to any parent of .viobox-container

Do not constrain width/height of .report-canvas to arbitrary values like 810x920px

Do not apply transform: scale(...) to .report-image or its container unless it is global and uniform

‚úÖ DO:
Match the .report-image scale and aspect ratio to the exact resolution of the PNG (e.g., 1920x1080)

Ensure that .viobox-container overlays precisely over .report-image using position: absolute with top/left = 0

Use transform-origin: top left and transform: scale(...) only if you are applying a uniform global zoom ‚Äî otherwise remove all transforms

All vioboxes must stay in 1:1 alignment with the report image, both during drag and after export (x, y, width, height)

üí° GENERAL REQUIREMENT
The goal is perfect 1:1 alignment between the credit report page as it appears in Viotagger and how it exists in the raw PNG file. What users see and what they tag must match exactly.

Use this baseline reference image for correction:
Correct sample: AL-EQ-2024-04-25-P57.png (1920√ó1080)
Compare with the broken versions shown in the staging environment.

Once corrected, confirm:

No scrunching or squishing

No hidden overflow

No mismatch in box alignment

Snap positions (e.g., EQ-A, EQ-B) line up accurately over the text

‚úÖ Approved. Please proceed with the fix exactly as described.

- Move `.viobox-container` outside of `.report-canvas` and make it a sibling inside `.report-canvas-container`
- Ensure it uses the same scale, positioning, and coordinate system as the PNG
- Make sure it overlays correctly and is no longer clipped by overflow or border-radius

No changes to VioTagger or SNAP POS logic.

1.content:
üß† You are being launched into a structural debug task for the VioVerse legal web application.

Your access is limited to the following folder:
üìÅ Path: `/home/avid_arrajeedavey/vioverse-refactor/`

üéØ Your immediate job is to fix a layout mismatch in the **Report View**. The visual overlays (`.viobox` elements) are currently being compressed due to a container issue.

---

‚úÖ STRUCTURAL RULES:

1. You may access and modify:
   - `/index.html`
   - `/css/refactor-ui.css`
   - Any JS files **only if needed to correct coordinate container mismatch** (not logic)

2. You may NOT:
   - Modify any VioTagger code or layout (`.tagger-*` classes)
   - Touch SNAP POS logic or transform math
   - Modify the `canvas-sync.js` or overlay drawing functions
   - Affect responsiveness or break mobile layout rules

---

üîç Context:

In the Report View:
- `.viobox-container` is currently constrained inside a visual wrapper (peach background)
- This causes all `.viobox` overlays to render compressed and misaligned
- The PNG image is correct, but the overlay box layer is **not allowed to fill the full 1920x1080 space**

---

‚úÖ YOUR TASK:

1. Identify the container that is constraining `.viobox-container`
2. Move `.viobox-container` outside this wrapper, or refactor its positioning context
3. Ensure `.viobox-container` is absolutely positioned against the same reference as the PNG
4. Both PNG and `.viobox-container` must use the same 1920x1080 coordinate space and transform scaling
5. Final result must match the VioTagger layout exactly

---

Once you‚Äôve located the layout issue and confirmed the correct class/structure, I will approve your fix.

1.content:
Please make the following corrections to the FCRA Review Summary layout in the index.html interface:

1. **Fix collapsed state content visibility:**
   - When a section is collapsed, its inner content should NOT be visible.
     - "filter this report": The heading and radio buttons should fully disappear.
     - "severity summary": The severity blocks (High, Medium, Low) should not display.
     - "violation details": All violation boxes should disappear (currently correct).

2. **Remove collapsed-state toggle icon:**
   - When a section is collapsed, do NOT show the tiny circular chevron icon inside that section.
   - These icons should only exist in the expanded version of the section stack.
   - They are redundant in collapsed mode and take up unnecessary space.

3. **Keep main top-row filter labels (e.g. ‚Äúshow filters‚Äù, ‚Äúshow severity‚Äù) as-is**
   - These should only appear *if* their corresponding section is currently collapsed.
   - If all 3 sections are expanded, the top label bar should be hidden.
   - When any section collapses, the label for that section should be shown (e.g., if filters collapse, show "show filters").

4. **Tighten spacing:**
   - Reduce vertical spacing between the three stack sections to approximately **12px**.
   - The current gap between sections is too large, especially when only one or two stacks are collapsed.

5. **Ensure responsiveness:**
   - All of the above logic must apply consistently across breakpoints:
     - Mobile (‚â§480px)
     - Tablet (481‚Äì768px)
     - Desktop (769‚Äì1439px)
     - Large Desktop (‚â•1440px)

6. **Do NOT remove or alter the expanded-state toggle buttons.**
   - These are the large circular chevron icons on the right side of each expanded section.
   - These must stay and remain fully functional.

Once complete, all sections should collapse cleanly and reclaim space in the sidebar. The UI will behave predictably and compactly.

Let me know once complete so we can validate before moving on to the next Phase 2 task.

cachedChangelog:
# Changelog

## 1.0.18

- Added --add-dir CLI argument for specifying additional working directories
- Added streaming input support without require -p flag
- Improved startup performance and session storage performance
- Added CLAUDE_BASH_MAINTAIN_PROJECT_WORKING_DIR environment variable to freeze working directory for bash commands
- Added detailed MCP server tools display (/mcp)
- MCP authentication and permission improvements
- Added auto-reconnection for MCP SSE connections on disconnect
- Fixed issue where pasted content was lost when dialogs appeared

## 1.0.17

- We now emit messages from sub-tasks in -p mode (look for the parent_tool_use_id property)
- Fixed crashes when the VS Code diff tool is invoked multiple times quickly
- MCP server list UI improvements
- Update Claude Code process title to display "claude" instead of "node"

## 1.0.11

- Claude Code can now also be used with a Claude Pro subscription
- Added /upgrade for smoother switching to Claude Max plans
- Improved UI for authentication from API keys and Bedrock/Vertex/external auth tokens
- Improved shell configuration error handling
- Improved todo list handling during compaction

## 1.0.10

- Added markdown table support
- Improved streaming performance

## 1.0.8

- Fixed Vertex AI region fallback when using CLOUD_ML_REGION
- Increased default otel interval from 1s -> 5s
- Fixed edge cases where MCP_TIMEOUT and MCP_TOOL_TIMEOUT weren't being respected
- Fixed a regression where search tools unnecessarily asked for permissions
- Added support for triggering thinking non-English languages
- Improved compacting UI

## 1.0.7

- Renamed /allowed-tools -> /permissions
- Migrated allowedTools and ignorePatterns from .claude.json -> settings.json
- Deprecated claude config commands in favor of editing settings.json
- Fixed a bug where --dangerously-skip-permissions sometimes didn't work in --print mode
- Improved error handling for /install-github-app
- Bugfixes, UI polish, and tool reliability improvements

## 1.0.6

- Improved edit reliability for tab-indented files
- Respect CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR everywhere
- Reduced unnecessary tool permission prompts
- Added support for symlinks in @file typeahead
- Bugfixes, UI polish, and tool reliability improvements

## 1.0.4

- Fixed a bug where MCP tool errors weren't being parsed correctly

## 1.0.1

- Added `DISABLE_INTERLEAVED_THINKING` to give users the option to opt out of interleaved thinking.
- Improved model references to show provider-specific names (Sonnet 3.7 for Bedrock, Sonnet 4 for Console)
- Updated documentation links and OAuth process descriptions

## 1.0.0

- Claude Code is now generally available
- Introducing Sonnet 4 and Opus 4 models

## 0.2.125

- Breaking change: Bedrock ARN passed to `ANTHROPIC_MODEL` or `ANTHROPIC_SMALL_FAST_MODEL` should no longer contain an escaped slash (specify `/` instead of `%2F`)
- Removed `DEBUG=true` in favor of `ANTHROPIC_LOG=debug`, to log all requests

## 0.2.117

- Breaking change: --print JSON output now returns nested message objects, for forwards-compatibility as we introduce new metadata fields
- Introduced settings.cleanupPeriodDays
- Introduced CLAUDE_CODE_API_KEY_HELPER_TTL_MS env var
- Introduced --debug mode

## 0.2.108

- You can now send messages to Claude while it works to steer Claude in real-time
- Introduced BASH_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_MS and BASH_MAX_TIMEOUT_MS env vars
- Fixed a bug where thinking was not working in -p mode
- Fixed a regression in /cost reporting
- Deprecated MCP wizard interface in favor of other MCP commands
- Lots of other bugfixes and improvements

## 0.2.107

- CLAUDE.md files can now import other files. Add @path/to/file.md to ./CLAUDE.md to load additional files on launch

## 0.2.106

- MCP SSE server configs can now specify custom headers
- Fixed a bug where MCP permission prompt didn't always show correctly

## 0.2.105

- Claude can now search the web
- Moved system & account status to /status
- Added word movement keybindings for Vim
- Improved latency for startup, todo tool, and file edits

## 0.2.102

- Improved thinking triggering reliability
- Improved @mention reliability for images and folders
- You can now paste multiple large chunks into one prompt

## 0.2.100

- Fixed a crash caused by a stack overflow error
- Made db storage optional; missing db support disables --continue and --resume

## 0.2.98

- Fixed an issue where auto-compact was running twice

## 0.2.96

- Claude Code can now also be used with a Claude Max subscription (https://claude.ai/upgrade)

## 0.2.93

- Resume conversations from where you left off from with "claude --continue" and "claude --resume"
- Claude now has access to a Todo list that helps it stay on track and be more organized

## 0.2.82

- Added support for --disallowedTools
- Renamed tools for consistency: LSTool -> LS, View -> Read, etc.

## 0.2.75

- Hit Enter to queue up additional messages while Claude is working
- Drag in or copy/paste image files directly into the prompt
- @-mention files to directly add them to context
- Run one-off MCP servers with `claude --mcp-config <path-to-file>`
- Improved performance for filename auto-complete

## 0.2.74

- Added support for refreshing dynamically generated API keys (via apiKeyHelper), with a 5 minute TTL
- Task tool can now perform writes and run bash commands

## 0.2.72

- Updated spinner to indicate tokens loaded and tool usage

## 0.2.70

- Network commands like curl are now available for Claude to use
- Claude can now run multiple web queries in parallel
- Pressing ESC once immediately interrupts Claude in Auto-accept mode

## 0.2.69

- Fixed UI glitches with improved Select component behavior
- Enhanced terminal output display with better text truncation logic

## 0.2.67

- Shared project permission rules can be saved in .claude/settings.json

## 0.2.66

- Print mode (-p) now supports streaming output via --output-format=stream-json
- Fixed issue where pasting could trigger memory or bash mode unexpectedly

## 0.2.63

- Fixed an issue where MCP tools were loaded twice, which caused tool call errors

## 0.2.61

- Navigate menus with vim-style keys (j/k) or bash/emacs shortcuts (Ctrl+n/p) for faster interaction
- Enhanced image detection for more reliable clipboard paste functionality
- Fixed an issue where ESC key could crash the conversation history selector

## 0.2.59

- Copy+paste images directly into your prompt
- Improved progress indicators for bash and fetch tools
- Bugfixes for non-interactive mode (-p)

## 0.2.54

- Quickly add to Memory by starting your message with '#'
- Press ctrl+r to see full output for long tool results
- Added support for MCP SSE transport

## 0.2.53

- New web fetch tool lets Claude view URLs that you paste in
- Fixed a bug with JPEG detection

## 0.2.50

- New MCP "project" scope now allows you to add MCP servers to .mcp.json files and commit them to your repository

## 0.2.49

- Previous MCP server scopes have been renamed: previous "project" scope is now "local" and "global" scope is now "user"

## 0.2.47

- Press Tab to auto-complete file and folder names
- Press Shift + Tab to toggle auto-accept for file edits
- Automatic conversation compaction for infinite conversation length (toggle with /config)

## 0.2.44

- Ask Claude to make a plan with thinking mode: just say 'think' or 'think harder' or even 'ultrathink'

## 0.2.41

- MCP server startup timeout can now be configured via MCP_TIMEOUT environment variable
- MCP server startup no longer blocks the app from starting up

## 0.2.37

- New /release-notes command lets you view release notes at any time
- `claude config add/remove` commands now accept multiple values separated by commas or spaces

## 0.2.36

- Import MCP servers from Claude Desktop with `claude mcp add-from-claude-desktop`
- Add MCP servers as JSON strings with `claude mcp add-json <n> <json>`

## 0.2.34

- Vim bindings for text input - enable with /vim or /config

## 0.2.32

- Interactive MCP setup wizard: Run "claude mcp add" to add MCP servers with a step-by-step interface
- Fix for some PersistentShell issues

## 0.2.31

- Custom slash commands: Markdown files in .claude/commands/ directories now appear as custom slash commands to insert prompts into your conversation
- MCP debug mode: Run with --mcp-debug flag to get more information about MCP server errors

## 0.2.30

- Added ANSI color theme for better terminal compatibility
- Fixed issue where slash command arguments weren't being sent properly
- (Mac-only) API keys are now stored in macOS Keychain

## 0.2.26

- New /approved-tools command for managing tool permissions
- Word-level diff display for improved code readability
- Fuzzy matching for slash commands

## 0.2.21

- Fuzzy matching for /commands
